turns.raw_header: You used the tag `!<q>` before your message. I’m interpreting that as a marker (possibly “quote” or “question”) rather than something that changes the meaning of “test”.
turns.body:
Your message content is simply:

> test

If you were just checking whether the system works: it does, I can see and respond to your message.
turns.footer: If `!<q>` is meant to trigger a specific behavior (e.g., special formatting, quoting, or a particular style of answer), tell me what you expect it to do and I’ll adapt my responses accordingly.

parsed_footer.raw: If `!<q>` is meant to trigger a specific behavior (e.g., special formatting, quoting, or a particular style of answer), tell me what you expect it to do and I’ll adapt my responses accordingly.

turns.raw_header: You used `!<o>` this time, with the content:
turns.body:
> second test

I’m treating `!<o>` as another marker (maybe “output” or “option”) unless you define it otherwise.

The system is receiving your messages correctly.
turns.footer: If `!<o>` is supposed to mean something specific (e.g., “be more detailed,” “only output JSON,” etc.), tell me the intended behavior and I’ll follow it.

parsed_footer.raw: If `!<o>` is supposed to mean something specific (e.g., “be more detailed,” “only output JSON,” etc.), tell me the intended behavior and I’ll follow it.
